As for branch scriptures,
they refer to those extracted from the great collection and circulated separately.
The second assembly of the Great Prajna Paramita Sutra is an example.ğŸ”½The Dharma gates are vast and rarely reach their depths.
The scriptures are numerous and their ends are not known.
Therefore, there are those who transform according to circumstances and respond to the conditions of beings.
Many times, from the great collection, they use what is appropriate for the time.
Those who peruse them do not know where they come from.
Those who practice them will not complete the meaning.
Now, gathering many ends, they return to the corresponding collection.
They still eliminate the old records, increasing and decreasing their existence.
Fully listing the titles, they are thoroughly examined.
It is hoped that future learners will know the source from the branches.
Or fearing it is not yet complete, I hope for the coming sages.
